definition: (biology) the basic structural and functional unit of all organisms; they may exist as independent units of life (as in monads) or may form colonies or tissues as in higher plants and animals
opposite_reasoning: While Cell lacks a true semantic antonym, Molecule provides the best category-level opposition by representing the boundary between living and non-living matter. Cells are biological units exhibiting life processes, while molecules are chemical structures that may be components of cells but lack the emergent properties of life. This distinction is scientifically meaningful and provides clear semantic distance. For Fisher-LDA, this should create a useful axis distinguishing biological organization from chemical structure. Artifact is a close second for capturing natural vs. artificial distinction, but Molecule provides clearer scientific grounding and scale-appropriate opposition.
